profile.biography:
I'm a Texan living in the UK for over 19 years. I currently work as a Senior Deployment Architect for a company called Cognito.

My strongest technical skills lie in problem solving and building new systems from scratch, often with emerging technologies, learning them as I go.

I also volunteer as a trustee and webmaster of The Druid Network - a registered charity in English and Wales. All the while juggling coursework for an Open University degree.

interests.title: Adventure
interests.description: XKCD says it best: "The infinite possibilities each day holds should stagger the mind. The sheer number of experiences I could have is uncountable, breathtaking, and I'm sitting here refreshing my inbox. We lived trapped in loops, reliving a few days over and over, and we envision only a handful of paths laid out ahead of us. We see the same things each day, we respond the same way, we think the same thoughts, each day a slight variation on the last, every moment smoothly following the gentle curves of societal norms. We act like if we just get through today, tomorrow our dreams will come back to us. And no, I don't have all the answers. I don't know how to jolt myself into seeing what each moment could become. But I do know one thing: the solution doesn't involve watering down my every little idea and creative impulse for the sake of some day easing my fit into a mold. It doesn't involve tempering my life to better fit someone's expectations. It doesn't involve constantly holding back for fear of shaking things up. This is very important, so I want to say it as clearly as I can: FUCK. THAT. SHIT."

interests.title: Technology and Geekery
interests.description: I first laid my hands on a computer - A Commodore 64 - in 1985. In a few days I'd written my first programme in Basic and I instantly knew this was what I was going to do with my life. A decade later, after moving to England and getting my permanent residency, I was trained as an Informix 4GL programmer.  While I was good at this, my passion was for doing the more complex systems administration tasks and when Linux starting becoming more popular I was hooked.  I've worked as some form of systems administrator ever since and eventually ended up managing other sys admins. It's paid the bills.  This year, I'm concentrating on learning metric collection tools such as CollectD, InfluxDB, and Grafana, along with various DevOps technologies such as CoreOS, Docker, Vagrant, and possibly Puppet and Elasticsearch.

interests.title: Gardening
interests.description: I took up an allotment garden in 2011 because I had a craving for better tomatoes! At various particular points in the year you'll find me organically growing onions, garlic, leeks, potatoes, peppers, cherries, pears, broad beans, runner beans, courgettes, carrots, rhubarb, peas, raspberries, blackberries, various herbs and spices, one or two pumpkins, and vast amounts of multi-coloured tomatoes that I either eat like candy, fill burgers with, or turn into salsa. I'm also a keen forager of blackberries and plums from roadside trees when they're in season.  During the winter I go sit in my shed in Saturday mornings whist drinking coffee and reading books.  When it's too cold to do that, I've actually learned how to knit!

interests.title: Fitness and Diet
interests.description: Ladies and gentlemen, I am now and have been for some time: a fat man. There's no getting away from that. I became lazy and complacent in my mid 20's. During my entire 30's I did no exercise and let my fitness just waste away. However, in the Summer of 2014, at the age of 41, with painful joints and possibly on the verge of getting diabetes, on the top of a mountain in the Scottish Highlands, I made a decision to lose just a bit more than 4 stone (56 lbs) over the next two years. To that end, I count calories (no fad diets!), avoid processed food in favour of fresh and home-made, walk or cycle or run every single day, and immensely enjoy a bit of yoga at a new studio in town. I won't lie - it's all bloody hard work. Failure however isn't even a possibility and a current goal is to achieve 3/4 of my target weight loss by the spring of 2016 and then cycle the length of Wales from Chepstow to Holyhead. To date I've lost around 25 lbs and I'm running a weekly 5k Parkrun race at 37 minutes. I'd like to get under 25 minutes by this winter!

interests.title: Environmental Studies, Politics, and Activism
interests.description: Ideologically I'm a social libertarian almost bordering on anarchist. Politically, in the UK, I strongly support the Green Party and share their values and ethics - but in fairness I support any political party that acts with compassion whist respecting basic human dignity as opposed to being in the pockets of big business. I regularly give to organisations that work to protect and conserve the environment, promote peace, encourage equality, or support social and environmental justice such as: Greenpeace, The Woodland Trust, World Wildlife Fund, and Friends of The Earth. Locally I support Newbury Cat's Protection by sponsoring a pen in memory of our cat Piper.

interests.title: Pagan Druidry
interests.description: Ah. Religion. A dirty work nowadays and not something people talk about in depth. This is the specific one I practice. Don't worry! I won't be trying to convert anyone. Nor will anyone catch me dancing naked around Stonehenge.  Have you been there?  It's always far too cold and windy for that nonsense!  ;-) To me, Druidry is simply a pathway to living with honour and intent, fiercely respecting and defending all of nature, the spirits of place, the gods, and my ancestors. It's also an outlet to sacrifice my time and energy in the service to my community.
